textSplit.heading: Container Orchestration
textSplit.content: Deploy, manage, and scale your containers with the Docker, Podman, or Singularity task driver.

textSplit.heading: Run On-Premise with Ease
textSplit.content: Install and run Nomad easily on bare metal as a single binary and with the same ease as on cloud.

textSplit.heading: Windows Support
textSplit.content: Deploy Windows containers and processes or run Nomad as a native Windows service with Service Control Manager and NSSM.

codeBlock.code:
sc.exe start "Nomad"
SERVICE_NAME: Nomad
      TYPE               : 10  WIN32_OWN_PROCESS
      STATE              : 4  RUNNING
                              (STOPPABLE, NOT_PAUSABLE, ACCEPTS_SHUTDOWN)
      WIN32_EXIT_CODE    : 0  (0x0)
      SERVICE_EXIT_CODE  : 0  (0x0)
      CHECKPOINT         : 0x0
      WAIT_HINT          : 0x0
      PID                : 8008
      FLAGS              :

textSplit.heading: Multi-Region Federation
textSplit.content: Federate Nomad clusters across regions with a single CLI command to deploy applications globally.

textSplit.heading: Edge Deployment with Simple Topology
textSplit.content: Deploy Nomad with a simple cluster topology on hybrid infrastructure to place workloads to the cloud or at the edge.

textSplit.heading: Zero Downtime Deployments
textSplit.content: Achieve zero downtime deployments for applications through rolling updates, blue/green, or canary deployment strategies.

textSplit.heading: High Performance Batch Workloads
textSplit.content: Run batch jobs with proven scalability of thousands of deployments per second via the batch scheduler.

textSplit.heading: Run Specialized Hardware with Device Plugins
textSplit.content: Run GPU and other specialized workloads using Nomadâ€™s device plugins.

textSplit.heading: Run Stateful Workloads
textSplit.content: Natively connect and run stateful services with storage volumes from third-party providers via the Container Storage Interface plugin system.

textSplit.heading: Flexible Networking Capabilities
textSplit.content: Deploy containerized applications with customized network configurations from third-party vendors via Container Network Interface plugin system
